intro: Scaphochlamys uniflora, commonly known as the single-flowered scaphochlamys, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring a single, showy flower that is often brightly colored. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branched. Scaphochlamys uniflora is of interest to botanists due to its specialized morphology and ecological adaptations.
